bwwExcerpt: Jeremy Pope's lead performance is a whirling, glittering thing of beauty - whether breathlessly tossing off McCraney's bitchy double entendres, swooping through solo vocal lines or executing Camille A. Brown's grinding, grooving choreography (based on South African gumboot dance). All the actors deserve high praise for seamlessly meshing on the many musical interludes based on hymns and spirituals (written and arranged by Jason Michael Webb), which are expertly woven into the naturalism of the r
